info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:55PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A cluster of showers with torrential rainfall will continue to impact portions of western Hampshire, central Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 1230 AM EDT... At 1054 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers with torrential rainfall over Goshen, or 8 miles northwest of Northampton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Northampton, Greenfield, Deerfield, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Westhampton, Whately, Chester, Blandford, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Plainfield and Middlefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
